thread.title: Small plane crashes in the waters off Star Island, Fla.; pilot able to escape before aircraft sank - @nbc6
thread.title_full: Small plane crashes in the waters off Star Island, Fla.; pilot able to escape before aircraft sank - @nbc6

author: Shelley Ng
title: Small plane crashes in the waters off Star Island, Fla.; pilot able to escape before aircraft sank - @nbc6
text:
Close Embed this video <script type="text/javascript" charset="UTF-8" src="http://www.nbcmiami.com/portableplayer/?cmsID=311648661&videoID=ORXlbY4ZYPpz&origin=nbcmiami.com&sec=news&subsec=local&width=600&height=360"></script> More videos (1 of 9) « » A small plane went down in the area of Star Island in Miami Saturday afternoon. But as NBC 6's Bobby Brooks reports, the pilot managed to escape unharmed. (Published Saturday, Jul 4, 2015) Updated at 6:28 PM EDT on Saturday, Jul 4, 2015 A small plane went down in the area of Star Island in Miami Saturday afternoon. Miami-Dade Fire Rescue officials said the plane crashed into the waters off Star Island around 2:45 p.m. The pilot was able to escape before the plane sunk and was pulled onto a fire boat. The U.S. Coast Guard is also investigating. It is not yet known what caused the plane to crash. The pilot is reportedly in good condition and did not suffer any injuries. "I'm good, safe," the pilot told NBC 6. "No one got hurt. That's the important part." Several agencies are working to determine who will retrieve the plane. This is a developing story. Stay with NBC 6 for updates. Published at 3:16 PM EDT on Jul 4, 2015 
News breaks at inconvenient times. Download one of the NBC6 mobile apps and have the news come to you. Watch live streaming newscasts, receive critical push notifications on the go and stay in touch with your city around the clock.
